page.title: 16THE LOCAL ENVIRONMENT
page.content: The Dene is situated north of the village, Castletown, and south of the ancient building, Hylton Castle. It lies in a west to east direction, with a small stream flowing east. Recent replanting has taken place in special enclosures. There are three established groups of trees more than 80 years old. The stream is occasionally littered with assorted rubbish and is overgrown in Summer. The established forest area at the centre of the Dene ends in a shrubbed valley with marsh plants growing on the valley floor. The Dene has generally retained its natural wildness, some of the areas unchanged in the last 50 years. Used by local people for walking; exercising dogs; recreation; and access beyond Castletown.
